label: 恵果
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Hui-kuo (Ch.) 恵果, also called 恵果阿闍梨、青龍寺和尚 Keika ajari, Shōryūji wajō in Japan. The Chinese master of the 真言 Chen-yen (J. Shingon) school under whom Kūkai studied, and who not only transmitted the denbō kanjō to Kūkai but also gave him a series of scriptures and implements to take back to Japan, including 80 grains of Buddha relics.
